data.text: And the
But for his kin, that is near unto him,
And for his sister a virgin, that is nigh unto him, which hath had no husband; for her may he be defiled.
They shall not make baldness upon their head, neither shall they shave off the corner of their beard, nor make any cuttings in their flesh.
They shall be holy unto their God, and not profane the name of their God: for the offerings of the
They shall not take a wife
Thou shalt sanctify him therefore; for he offereth the bread of thy God: he shall be holy unto thee: for I the
¶ And the daughter of any priest, if she profane herself by playing the whore, she profaneth her father: she shall be burnt with fire.
And
Neither shall he go in to any dead body, nor defile himself for his father, or for his mother;
Neither shall he go out of the sanctuary, nor profane the sanctuary of his God; for the crown of the anointing oil of his God
And he shall take a wife in her virginity.
A widow, or a divorced woman, or profane,
Neither shall he profane his seed among his people: for I the

For whatsoever man
Or a man that is brokenfooted, or brokenhanded,
Or crookbackt, or a dwarf, or that hath a blemish in his eye, or be scurvy, or scabbed, or hath his stones broken;
No man that hath a blemish of the seed of Aaron the priest shall come nigh to offer the offerings of the
He shall eat the bread of his God,
